answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
While looking into your question I found that how municipalities deal with this position varies greatly.  I found job descriptions and department listings from different places to determine where in the government their tourism coordinator worked. You may want to contact the municipalities individually for more information about their way of handling the title.
In North Charleston, SC the position falls under the, Executive Department.
http://www.northcharleston.org/residents/government/mayor/execdept.aspx 
Also, in Mariposa County, CA they place the Tourism Coordinator under a similar County Administration Office.
http://www.mariposacounty.org/DocumentView.aspx?DID=2003
Other areas chose to put the position under an Economic Development Office. You can see those places below.
Cecil County, MD: 
http://www.cecilcounty.us/ecdev/contact_us.cfm
Richmond, VA: http://richmondvadevelopment.blogspot.com/2011/07/city-selects-coordinator-of.html
Lake County, FL: http://www.lakecountyfl.gov/departments/economic_development_and_tourism/ 
In two places I found that the tourism coordinator and a similar, smaller office worked under the Parks and Recreation department. 
Gloucester, VA:  http://www.gloucesterva.info/ParksandRecreation/Information/tabid/317/Default.aspx 
Botetourt County, VA: http://www.botetourt.org/employment/documents/tourism_coord.pdf 
Lastly, I only found one area where there was a standalone tourism office. Randolph County places the position under their Tourism Development Authority. 
http://www.co.randolph.nc.us/hr/ClassSpecs/TourismCoordinator.pdf 
I hope these are helpful!
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
